guidelines.title: Topic
guidelines.content: General Knowledge and Technical Knowledge

guidelines.title: Duration
guidelines.content: 2 hours

guidelines.title: Max Count
guidelines.content: 25 teams

guidelines.title: Guidelines
guidelines.content:
Each team consists of two participants.
 The competition is conducted through 2 rounds. 
 First round will be MCQ and the second is buzzer round.
Malpractice or any misconduct will lead to disqualification.
The authority has full rights to make any changes to the program.

guidelines.title: Round 1
guidelines.content:
Each team would be given a set of question papers containing 25 objective type questions (MCQ).
The time limit of 1st round is 30 mins.
Marks will be given for each correct answer.
There will be no negative marking.
5 questions will be starred.
In case of a tie between 2 or more teams, the team that has correctly answered the most number of starred questions will advance into next level.
The top 8 scoring teams will qualify for the next round.

guidelines.title: Round 2 : KNOCKOUT
guidelines.content:
The 8 qualifying teams will compete in a knockout format.
Matches will be held one team against another.
Each team must compete against and defeat an opponent in a head-to-head match to advance to the next round.
Each match will consist of a set of buzzer questions.
The winners of each stage will proceed to the next stage until the final.
In case of a tie, a tie-breaker question will be asked.

guidelines.title: Duration
guidelines.content: 2 Hour 15 minutes

guidelines.title: Max Count
guidelines.content: 8 teams

guidelines.title: Guidelines
guidelines.content:
General
 Each team must consist of 3-5 members.
 A maximum of 8 teams will be allowed to participate.
 Proper decorum must be maintained throughout the event.
 Any disruptive behavior will lead to immediate disqualification.
 Exceeding the allotted time will result in negative marks.
 The final stage of the competition will be conducted on the main stage.
 Judges or the organizing authority reserve the right to modify the rules.

guidelines.title: Evaluation Criteria
guidelines.content:
Content & Relevance
 Clarity & Presentation
 Teamwork
 Opposition Handling

guidelines.title: Judging & Results
guidelines.content: The decision of the judges will be final and binding.

guidelines.title: Duration
guidelines.content: 45 Minutes

guidelines.title: Team Size
guidelines.content: Minimum: 2 members, Maximum: 4 members

guidelines.title: Requirements
guidelines.content: Each participant must have their own system and internet provision

guidelines.title: Guidelines
guidelines.content:
Participants will be given a product/theme on the spot.
They have to design a brochure using AI tools within the given time.
The brochure must be presented before the judges.
Judges will evaluate based on creativity, clarity, innovation, and presentation skills.

guidelines.title: Event Modifications
guidelines.content: The coordinators reserve the right to modify or take decisions regarding any aspect of the event.

guidelines.title: Duration
guidelines.content: The problem must be solved within 30 minutes maximum.

guidelines.title: Guidelines
guidelines.content:
Internet usage, mobile phones, or any external references are strictly prohibited. If found, the participant will be disqualified immediately.
Only individual participation is allowed.
A system will be provided for each participant.

guidelines.title: Round 1 : Reverse Coding
guidelines.content:
Participants must write a C program that produces an output almost identical to the given one.
Minor variations (like an extra space or newline) may be tolerated, but the meaning and structure must match.
Hardcoding the full output directly (just writing one printf("‚Ä¶")) is not allowed, unless the problem specifically permits it.
The problem must be solved within 30 minutes maximum.

guidelines.title: Evaluation Criteria
guidelines.content:
Output: Must be almost the same as the given output.
Logic: Code should logically derive the result.
Neatness: Proper indentation and structure.
Time: Completed within the allotted 30 minutes.

guidelines.title: Round 2 : Algorithm Race
guidelines.content:
Participants must write an algorithm for the given problem statement.
The participant must write the solution as an algorithm/pseudocode (not full program code).
Judges will evaluate based on correctness, efficiency, and clarity.
The problem must be solved within 30 minutes maximum.

guidelines.title: Evaluation Criteria
guidelines.content:
Correctness: Algorithm must provide the correct solution for the given problem.
Efficiency: Preference will be given to algorithms with minimum time complexity.
Clarity: Steps should be clearly written, logically ordered, and unambiguous.
Time: Completed within the allotted 30 minutes.

guidelines.title: Duration
guidelines.content: 1.5 Hr

guidelines.title: Participants
guidelines.content: Maximum of 20 participants can compete(first-come, first-servedbasis).

guidelines.title: Task
guidelines.content: Participants must solve each task using only one prompt. No retries,edits, or multiple submissions.

guidelines.title: Tools
guidelines.content: Use only the designated/approved software. External assistance such asAI-based auto-completion, plugins, or third-party tools is strictly prohibited.

guidelines.title: Evaluation Criteria
guidelines.content:
Effectiveness: How well does the prompt elicit the intended response?
Creativity: How unique and innovative is the prompt?
Clarity: The prompt should be concise and easy to understand.

guidelines.title: Scoring
guidelines.content: Based on prompt performance, creativity, and adherence to the task.

guidelines.title: Rounds: The competition will be conducted in two rounds:
guidelines.content:
Round 1: 15 mins
Round 2: 20 mins
Scores from both rounds will be combined to determine the winner.

guidelines.title: Note:
guidelines.content: Each participant will be assigned a computer for the competition.

guidelines.title: Duration
guidelines.content: 2hrs

guidelines.title: Guidelines
guidelines.content:
Participants must be present at the venue 10 minutes before the event starts.
Internet Usage, mobile phones or any external references are strictly prohibited. If found, participants will be disqualified immediately.
A Team must contain 4 members.
Total 30min for completing the program.
The Rules of Engagement:
The first team member begins their turn, and the 5-minute timer starts.
Only the person whose turn it is may touch the keyboard and mouse to write, debug, or refactor code.
When the 5-minute timer rings, the Coder must immediately step away from the setup. They cannot finish the line of code they are on‚Äîthey must stop instantly.
The next team member immediately takes the seat. The clock continues to run down the total time.
Team members who are not currently coding are absolutely allowed (and encouraged) to talk, plan, and strategize with the Coder.

guidelines.title: Max Count
guidelines.content: 20 (from 20, 6 teams will be shortlisted)

guidelines.title: Participation Mode
guidelines.content: : Individual / Team (max 3 members)

guidelines.title: Guidelines
guidelines.content:
Originality is mandatory: plagiarism or copying existing solutions will lead to disqualification.
Judges‚Äô decision is final and binding.

guidelines.title: Phase 1: Idea Development (Before the Event)
guidelines.content:
The topic/theme will be announced to participants in advance.
Each participant/team must submit an abstract based on the given topic.
The abstract should be 1‚Äì2 pages and include:
Problem Statement ‚Äì what issue are you addressing?
Proposed Idea ‚Äì your solution in brief.

guidelines.title: Phase 2: Idea Pitching
guidelines.content:
Each participant/team will get:
  5‚Äì7 minutes for presentation.
  5 minutes Q&A from judges.
Presentations should cover:
  Problem Statement (what issue are you solving?)
 Proposed Idea (your solution)
   Innovation (how is it new compared to existing solutions?)
   Feasibility (can it be implemented realistically?)
   Sustainability Impact (environmental, social, or economic benefits)
   Scalability (future potential, long-term impact)

guidelines.title: Duration
guidelines.content: 1 Hour

guidelines.title: Guidelines
guidelines.content:
Participants must be present at the venue 10 minutes before the event starts.
Only individual participation is allowed.
All participants must bring their college ID card.
Each participant will be assigned a computer/laptop with necessary tools for the competition.
Use of external tools (autocorrect, spell-checker, grammar checkers, etc.) is strictly prohibited.
Any participant found engaging in malpractice will be disqualified immediately.
The competition will consist of 3 rounds (Warm-up, Medium, and Advanced).
Score will be based on typing speed (WPM) and accuracy.
Results will be announced after evaluation.
Organizers reserve the right to make changes in rules.

  You know the rules. Now secure the VICTORY.

guidelines.title: Mode
guidelines.content: Online

guidelines.title: Guidelines
guidelines.content:
All matches will be played on Valorant (PC) through custom lobbies (private room codes) created by the organizers.
Players must use their own Riot ID and Valorant account. Smurfing or account sharing is strictly prohibited.
Players must have a stable internet connection and ensure their setup (PC, peripherals, software) is working before the match.
Players must join the lobby on time. Teams failing to join within 10 minutes of scheduled time may be disqualified.
Tournament format: Knockout (Single Elimination). Finals may be Best of 3 (BO3).
Map Veto Process: Both teams will ban and pick maps before each match (as guided by the organizers).

guidelines.title: Registration
guidelines.content:
Free for Computer Science students.
‚Çπ50 registration fee for students from other departments.
Team size: 5 registered players only. Substitutes are allowed but must be declared before the event.
Voice communication must be through the in-game chat or an organizer-approved platform (e.g., Discord).
Unfair play (cheats, unauthorized software, ghosting via streams, exploiting bugs) will lead to instant disqualification.

guidelines.title: In case of disconnects:
guidelines.content:
If before the round starts ‚Üí the round may be restarted.
If mid-round ‚Üí the game continues; the disconnected player may rejoin.
Each team is allowed 1 tactical timeout (1 min) per map.
Players must not use abusive chat/voice. Sportsmanship is expected at all times.
The organizers reserve the right to modify the rules if necessary, and their decisions will be final and binding.

guidelines.title: Instructions
guidelines.content:
Starting point: CSE Dept
Maximum no.of team: 7
Starting time: 10.00 am
Duration: 2 hrs 30 min
Team should contain 2-5 members
Participants should complete their task within the time limit
The competition will start at the exact time announced
Participants are required to follow all the instructions given by the volunteers during the competition.
Competition organizers reserve the right to modify rules.
Any form of cheating or malpractice will lead to immediate disqualification
